result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Tumuakong Lee was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Tumuakong Lee was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tumuakong Lee

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.

AS TO COUNT 4:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.


Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on AUGUST 26TH, 2022
Serve 60 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work and treatment. Report Date: SEPTEMBER 1ST, 2022 BY 5:00PM
Defendant eligible for good time and electronic monitoring.
Complete 25 hours of community service.
No driving without a valid driver's license and insurance.
No use or possession of alcohol.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Complete a firearm safety course.

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 12 months.  
Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 12 months on any vehicle owned, operated, and titled in the defendant's name.
Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

COUNT 1: Pay fine in the amount of $350.00 inclusive of ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
COUNT 4: Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on AUGUST 26TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Tumuakong Lee in court.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn in court for Tumuakong Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 4.

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 2 Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED as a matter of law.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 5  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing to proceed.

Defendant Tumuakong Lee in court with attorney Eric R Pangburn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tumuakong Lee appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defense needs to file the plea addendum paperwork.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Elements/Jury Instructions

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Defendant Tumuakong Lee in court with attorney Eric R Pangburn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense has discovery and offer, requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Tumuakong Lee in court with attorney Eric R Pangburn.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 049049,
Payable Number: 1008660,
Receipt Number: 22RP021055,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/23/22 @ 1p
